article.headline: Niagara 73, Loyola 71
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Stanley Hodge scored a career-high 18 points as Niagara defeated Loyola 73-71 Friday night. Leading 57-55 with seven minutes remaining Niagara (18-11, 12-5 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) went on a quick 7-0 run. Hodges field goal made it 64-55. Marquis Sullivans desperation 3-pointer with 4.7 seconds left gave Loyola (16-12, 11-6 MAAC) a chance, trailing 72-71. After Niagara's Charron Fisher made one of two free throws the Greyhounds had one more possession trailing by two but Michael Tuck's long, 3/4 court-length pass was intercepted by Lorenzo Miles. Niagara led 38-24 at halftime but the Greyhounds crawled back into the game with a 13-6 run to open the second half and a 12-3 run through the middle stages of the period. Miles finished with 17 points for Niagara. Charron Fisher had 16. Gerald Brown scored 29 points for Loyola and was 10-10 from the free throw-line. Omari Isreal added 12 points. Niagara has won seven-straight, their longest winning streak since 1992-93. Loyola was eliminated from contention for the MAAC regular season championship.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
